channel.title: Wasserstein GAN on Tong Shen

item.title: Amazing GAN - Wasserstein GAN
item.description: KL divergence and JS divergence Before diving into details, let first review two very important metrics to quantify the similarity of two probability distributions: Kullback-Leibler Divergence and Jensen-Shannon Divergence. Kullback-Leibler Divergence measures the divergence of probability distribution p(x) to q(x): $$KL(P||Q) = \int_x P(x)log\frac{P(x)}{Q(x)}dx$$ KL(P||Q) achieves its minimum zero when P(x) and Q(x) are the same everywhere. KL divergence is widely used as a metrics to measure the similarity between two distributions.
